definition: to hope to reach/to strive for
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]

sentences.english: It's far beyond reach of our ability to obtain such aim.
sentences.chinese: 按我們的能力這種目標是不可企及的。

sentences.english: This is the sort of bull's-eye at which Salinger is unmatched.
sentences.chinese: 塞林格這種精準的描述是任何人也無法企及的。

sentences.english: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.
sentences.chinese: 人們通過不斷犯錯誤接近不可企及的真理。

sentences.english: Human indeed hard to attain clever pen.
sentences.chinese: 人類丹青妙筆難以企及。

sentences.english: I do not believe that billionaire and I have unattainable distance.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信億萬富翁與我有不可企及的距離。

sentences.english: Hills are the earth's gesture of despair for the unreachable.
sentences.chinese: 平地是大地向那永難企及的天際映現的絕望站姿。

sentences.english: The newly created plays can rarely reach the level of the classics.
sentences.chinese: 新排的劇難以企及經典的高度。

sentences.english: Bin Laden's seeming temperance made his manifest bloody-mindedness all the harder to fathom.
sentences.chinese: 拉登的表現似乎讓他戒酒血腥的胸襟所有難以企及的。

sentences.english: It's far beyond their reach to obtain such aim.
sentences.chinese: 按他們的能力這種目標是不可企及的。

sentences.english: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not of.
sentences.chinese: 心靈世界自有其道理，非理智所能企及。

sentences.english: I do not know that he is in search of their dreams or in the prices and that the doors can not be touched.
sentences.chinese: 不知自己是在尋夢還是在企及那不可觸及的門扉。

sentences.english: This condition, it seems, is difficult to attain without a special diet and frequent fasting.
sentences.chinese: 這種情況好象沒有特別的飲食和頻繁的禁食難以企及。

sentences.english: Wake up, you are my distant far beyond one's reach.
sentences.chinese: 一覺醒來，你是我不可企及的遙遠。
人類丹青妙筆難以企及。

definition: to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior

pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
in sight but unattainable (idiom)/inaccessible/also written 可望而不可及[ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2]
pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: according to one's capabilities/what sb is capable of
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
accomplishment/success/achievement/CL:個|个[ge4]/to achieve (a result)/to create/to bring about
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
unattainable/far-fetched/out of reach/exceedingly remote or distant
to set foot on (a foreign land etc)/to tread/(fig.) to enter (a new sphere)
